node.title: Would you work in the bush if the government paid your university debt?
node.description: Under a new scheme designed to lure health professionals to rural, regional and remote areas, the government will wipe or reduce the university debt of doctors and nurses heading bush.
node.content:
["Would you work in the bush if the government wiped your university debt?", "That's what's on offer for doctors and nurse practitioners\u00a0under a new scheme aimed at attracting more health professionals to rural, regional and remote areas.", "From January 2022, the federal government will wipe the university debt of doctors or nurse practitioners, under a few conditions.", "If they are in a remote community, they must work at least 24 hours a week\u00a0for a period equivalent to half the length of their degree.", "While those in rural and regional areas will need to work the same number of hours over a period as long as their entire degree.", "Regional Health Minister David Gillespie told the ABC the incentives were on top of current benefits, such as\u00a0scholarship programs and additional Medicare benefits.", "\"The more remote you go, the more significant the practice incentive payment or the workforce incentive payment is,\" Dr Gillespie said.", "\"This is an extra to what we have already.\u00a0", "\"It is targeted because there is an acute shortage of general practitioners in the outer, regional and remote areas \u2014 more so than anywhere else.\"", "", "
Minister for Regional Health David Gillespie says the incentives will increase for people working in more remote areas.\u00a0(AAP: Mick Tsikas)
", "It is an important move, according to John Hall, a GP in the rural Queensland town of St George, who believes it will lure more\u00a0doctors and nurse practitioners to the bush.", "\"The incentive here is huge,\" Dr Hall said.", "\"This is a significant incentive for junior doctors and nurses as well to look at an early career in rural areas.\"", "The government is also making it easier for more rural and regional areas to recruit health practitioners typically reserved for very remote areas, like doctors who've trained overseas.", "Currently, GPs from overseas and doctors who are on special scholarships are forced to work in so-called \"distribution priority areas\" for a fixed period after they have arrived.", "Dr Hall said under the changes, those doctors would be able to work in more places.", "\"Essentially they are broadening the eligibility criteria for this program so more rural communities will be able to attract and employ overseas-trained doctors, where in the past, they didn't meet that eligibility criteria because it was only for more remote areas.\"", "
Will this work?
", "Attracting doctors to regional and remote areas has been an age-old problem, and while numerous carrots have been\u00a0dangled by successive governments, the workforce gap has remained.", "It is a significant issue, especially given about 28 per cent of the Australian population lives\u00a0in rural and remote areas, and those people\u00a0have higher rates of hospitalisations, deaths, and injury than those in major cities.", "Two years ago the small community of Temora in south-west New South Wales took matters into its own hands, creating a music video to help lure doctors to the area.\u00a0", "Local GP Rachel Christmas said the town still needed more doctors.", "\"The demand on our service is always greater than what we're actually able to provide,\" she said.", "\"We constantly hear comments like,\u00a0'But I can't get an appointment to see you. I can't get the doctor that I want to see. The waiting time is too long.'\u00a0", "\"So that's part of the problem.\"", "For Dr Christmas, diagnosing the problem has been much easier than prescribing a solution.", "\"If I knew the answer, then I'd be an extremely wealthy woman. It's a very, very complex area,\" she said.", "\"We have to look at ways we can make that, you know, make it more attractive for people.\"", "Peta Rutherford, CEO of the Rural Doctors Association of Australia, said this latest government pitch would do exactly that:\u00a0make regional, rural and remote areas more attractive places to work.", "\"It's certainly an initiative that we welcome,\" she said.", "\"It's an important one \u2026\u00a0junior doctors have a significant level of HECS or HELP debt at the end of university.", "", "
Head of the Rural Doctors Association of Australia, Peta Rutherford, welcomed\u00a0the scheme.(Supplied: RDAA)
", "However she noted it was no silver bullet.", "\"It really is about ensuring that the government's strategies recognise the full scope of practice of rural GPs and rural generalists and ensuring that they get a fair remuneration package,\" she said.", "\"But also looking at some of the social elements that go with working in a rural community as a doctor. Often that has impacts in relation to children's education or partner employment.", "\"There's multiple things that need to be considered.\""]
